name: Bail jumping in the second degree
text:
(1)  A person commits the offense of bail jumping in the second degree if, having been released from custody by court order with or without bail, upon condition that the person will subsequently appear as ordered in connection with a charge of having committed a misdemeanor or a petty misdemeanor, the person intentionally fails to appear as ordered. 
	(2)  Bail jumping in the second degree is a misdemeanor. [L 1972, c 9, pt of §1; gen ch 1993]
